<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[93, 278, 216, 293]]<|/det|>
## MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 299, 210, 313]]<|/det|>
Paper 3 (Core)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 339, 415, 354]]<|/det|>
Candidates answer on the Question Paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 359, 465, 389]]<|/det|>
Additional Materials: Electronic calculator Tracing paper (optional)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[567, 358, 753, 372]]<|/det|>
Geometrical instruments  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[93, 404, 386, 420]]<|/det|>
## READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 431, 718, 501]]<|/det|>
Write your Centre number, candidate number and name on all the work you hand in. Write in dark blue or black pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs. Do not use staples, paper clips, glue or correction fluid. DO NOT WRITE IN ANY BARCODES.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 514, 254, 528]]<|/det|>
Answer all questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 528, 652, 543]]<|/det|>
If working is needed for any question it must be shown below that question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 543, 375, 556]]<|/det|>
Electronic calculators should be used.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 556, 904, 585]]<|/det|>
If the degree of accuracy is not specified in the question, and if the answer is not exact, give the answer to three significant figures. Give answers in degrees to one decimal place.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 585, 444, 599]]<|/det|>
For \(\pi\) , use either your calculator value or 3.142.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 611, 756, 655]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together. The number of marks is given in brackets [ ] at the end of each question or part question. The total of the marks for this paper is 104.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 73, 96, 90]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 146, 90]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 625, 90]]<|/det|>
Some people each recorded their favourite holiday destination.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 88, 443, 104]]<|/det|>
The results are shown in the pie chart.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[255, 120, 739, 460]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 485, 181, 503]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[195, 485, 527, 502]]<|/det|>
Complete the statements about the pie chart.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[195, 516, 680, 533]]<|/det|>
The sector angle for Mexico is ............................................ degrees.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[195, 547, 621, 564]]<|/det|>
The most popular destination is ............................................

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[195, 572, 551, 600]]<|/det|>
\(\frac{1}{5}\) of the people chose ............................................

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[195, 609, 856, 625]]<|/det|>
Three times as many people chose ........................................... as ............................................ [4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 640, 180, 657]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[195, 640, 368, 657]]<|/det|>
180 people chose Bali.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[195, 672, 539, 688]]<|/det|>
Find how many people were asked altogether.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[663, 733, 918, 750]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[117, 73, 146, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 590, 88]]<|/det|>
Mr and Mrs Baker go on holiday with their three children.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 88, 437, 103]]<|/det|>
They fly from Miami to Mexico City.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 119, 180, 135]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 119, 470, 134]]<|/det|>
The cost of each adult ticket is \$450.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 135, 677, 150]]<|/det|>
The cost of each child ticket is \(70\%\) of the cost of an adult ticket.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 166, 504, 181]]<|/det|>
Calculate the total cost of the five tickets.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[651, 273, 918, 288]]<|/det|>
<form>$- ............................................................ [3]$

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 304, 180, 320]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 304, 443, 319]]<|/det|>
The plane leaves Miami at 09.29.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 320, 568, 335]]<|/det|>
It arrives in Mexico City 2 hours 11 minutes later.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 336, 739, 351]]<|/det|>
The local time in Miami is 1 hour ahead of the local time in Mexico City.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 367, 624, 382]]<|/det|>
Work out the time in Mexico City when the plane arrives.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[663, 490, 918, 505]]<|/det|>
<form> ............................................................ [2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[146, 520, 180, 537]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 520, 500, 535]]<|/det|>
The family travels 38 kilometres by taxi.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 536, 734, 551]]<|/det|>
The journey costs \$3.50 plus an extra \$2.15 for each kilometre travelled.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 567, 405, 583]]<|/det|>
Find the cost of the journey.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[651, 660, 918, 675]]<|/det|>
<form>$- ............................................................ [2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[146, 691, 180, 707]]<|/det|>
<label>(iv)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 691, 702, 706]]<|/det|>
At the end of the holiday Mr Baker changes 1335 pesos into dollars.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[195, 707, 477, 721]]<|/det|>
The exchange rate is \$1 = 17.8 pesos.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 738, 515, 753]]<|/det|>
Find how many dollars Mr Baker receives.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[651, 815, 918, 830]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 384, 88]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 88, 468, 103]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 103, 468, 118]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 134, 895, 165]]<|/det|>
